official-title.#text:
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for
		  limitations on detentions of certain individuals, and for other
		  purposes.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in
			 addition to the Committees on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
No Detention without Charge Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 4001 of
			 title 18, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
over the use of the Armed Forces of the United States may not
				authorize the apprehension or detention of any person except to the extent that
				the Constitution, the law of war, and otherwise applicable human rights law
				permits.

text.#text:
An authorization for the use of military
				force, a declaration of war, or any similar Act pertaining to the authority of
				the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
over the use of
				the Armed Forces of the United States may not authorize the detention without
				charge of any person apprehended or detained in the United States, or a
				territory or possession of the United States.

text.#text:
Except as expressly provided by an Act of
				Congress, an authorization for the use of military force, a declaration of war,
				or any similar Act pertaining to the authority of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
applies to an authorization
				for the use of military force, a declaration of war, or any similar Act
				pertaining to the authority of the

over the use of the Armed Forces
				of the United States enacted before, on, or after the date of enactment of this
				subsection.

text.#text:
A person may assert a violation of this
				section as a claim or defense in a judicial proceeding and obtain appropriate
				relief against a government. Standing to assert a claim or defense under this
				section shall be governed by the general rules of standing under Article III of
				the Constitution.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not constitute
			 an Act of Congress expressly providing an exception to the prohibition in that
			 subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Authorization for Use
			 of Military Force

header.#text:
Repeal of
			 requirement for military custody
